EXECUTIVE SUMMARY, THE CITY OF CUMMING RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN:
FOR SAFE CHLORINE HANDLING INVOLVES A UNIFIED EFFORT, INTEGRATING MODERN TECHNOLGY
PROCEDURES AND MANAGEMENT PRACTICES TO MONITOR POTENTIAL CHLORINE HAZARDS AND MINIMIZE THE RISK OF ACCIDENTAL CHLORINE RELEASES. ALL APPLICABLE PROCEDURES OF
40 CER 68.170 ARE ADDRESSED IN THIS RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN, WHICH SEEKS TO PRODUCE FOR EMPLOYEE SAFETY, PUBLIC HEALTH AND REPONSE AGENCY INTERACTION.

THE CITY OF CUMMING WATER TREATMENT PLANT DRAWS RAW  WATER FROM LAKE LANIER. 6
TREATED (FINISHED) WATER FROM THE PLANT SERVES RESIDENTS IN THE CITY OF CUMMING AND NEIGHBORING AREAS IN FORSYTH COUNTY. THE RAW WATER AND FINISHED WATER ARE DISINFECTED WITH CHLORINE. THE CHLORINATION PROCESS USES CHLORINE CYLINDERS (TON CONTAINERS),CHLORINATION EQUIPMENT RELEVANT INSTRUMENTATION, ELECTRIC AND PROCESS 
SAFETY EQUIPMENT.

THE" WORST CASE" SCENARIO; AS DEFINED BY U.S.EPA. STATES THAT "THE OWNER OR OPERATOR SHALL ASSUME THAT THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY IN THE LARGEST VESSEL IS RELEASED AS A GAS OVER 10 MINUTES."ALTERNATIVE SCENARIO" IS DEFINED AS "MORE LIKELY TO OCCUR THEN THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO". A REVIEW OF THE PAST INCIDENT HISTORY FOR THIS FACILITY WAS MADE AND FOUND THAT THERE WAS NO ACCIDENT RELEASE OF CHLORINE GAS FOR THE LAST FIVE YEARS OR MORE.

THE CITY OF CUMMING WATER PRODUCTION FACILITY IS LOCATED IN AN AREA WITH FEW BUILDIINGS 
OR OTHER OBSTRUCTIONS AND SO IT IS ASSUMED AS RURAL CONDITIONS. THE GUIDANCE ASSUMES 
METEOROLOGICAL CONDITIONS FOR THE WORST CASE SCENARIO OF ATMOSPHERE STABILITY CLASS "F"  (STABLE ATMOSPHERE) AND WIND SPEED 1.5 METERS PER SECOND (3.4 MILES PER HOUR)
AMBIENT AIR TEMPERATURE FOR THIS GUIDANCE IS 25 DEGREES CELSIUS (77 DEGREES FAHRENHEIT). THIS AMBIENT TEMPERATURE IS ASSUMED FOR THE WORST CASE, AS PER GUIDANCE, EVEN IF THE MAXIMUM TEMPERATURE,  AT THIS LOCATION IN THE LAST THREE YEARS WAS HIGHER.

THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO FOR THIS FACILITY INVOLVES A FAILURE OF AN ONE TON
CYLINDER YEIL

D OF A CUMULATIVE RELEASE OF 2000 POUNDS OF CHLORINE. WHEN ATMOSPHERIC
DISPERSION MODELING FOR THIS UNLIKELY SCENARIO WAS PERFORMED USING THE EPA GUIDANCE
DOCUMENT, A DISTANCE TO TOXIC END POINT OF 3.0 MILES WAS OBTAINED.

THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE (MORE LIKELY) SCENARIO FOR CHLORINATION PROCESS INVOLVES
MECHANICAL FAILURE OF ONE FLEXIBLE MANIFOLD CONNECTION (PIGTAIL) ALLOWING THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ONE TON CYLINDER OF CHLORINE OVER AN ONE HOUR PERIOD.

AS PER EPA GUIDANCE (SIMILAR ATMOSPHERIC MODELING) YIELDS A MORE LIKELY FIGURE OF 
0.36 MILE AFFECTED RADIUS UNDER NORMAL ATMOSPHERIC CONDITIONS AT FACILITY SITE.

THE CITY OF CUMMING RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM OR PLAN INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING SALIENT
FACTORS TO MITIGATE THE EFFECTS OF POTENTIAL CHLORINE RELEASE.
   OPERATOR TRAINING FOR NORMAL OPERATION AS WELL AS FOR EMERGENCY SITUATIONS
   ON A REGULAR BASIS.
   PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE PROGRAM.
   SAFETY EQUIPMENT.
   SAFE AND EFFECTIVE STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES, WRITTEN WITH OPERATOR 
   PARTICIPATION.
   HAZARD REVIEW OF EQUIPMENT AND PROCEDURES ON A REGULAR BASIS.
   AUDITING AND INSPECTION PROGRAMS.
   COMPREHENSIVE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM.

THE CITY OF CUMMING WATER PRODUCTION DEPARTMENT HAS AN ACTIVE HEALTH AND SAFETY PROCEDURE AND PROGRAM WITH THE BELOW MENTIONED SUPPORTING ELEMENTS FOR SAFE
HANDLING OF CHLORINE AND CHLORINATION PROCESS:
   CHEMICAL RIGHT TO KNOW PROGRAM  
   CHLORINE DETECTORS.
   ALARM SYSTEM.
   RESPIRATORY PROTECTION (SCBA) PROGRAM.
   PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT.

THE CITY OF CUMMING WATER PRODUCTION DEPARTMENT AND FORSYTH COUNTY FIRE DEPARTMENT ARE WORKING ON IMPLEMENTING AN EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN. THE WATER PRODUCTION DEPARTMENT IS TAKING ALL POSITIVE AND PROACTIVE APPROACH TO RISK MANAGEMENT AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE THROUGH TRANING SESSIONS AND CONTINUOUSLY MAINTAIN EFFECTIVE PROCEDURE, FOR THE SAFE HANDLING AND TIMELY REPONSE FOR ANY POTENTIAL CHLORINE LEAK.
